TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit FormTemplate extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPersistedObject implements class Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.Backup.IBackupRestore, class Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.Backup.IBackupRestoreConfiguration
Public NotInheritable Class FormTemplate Inherits SPPersistedObject Implements IBackupRestoreConfiguration

Docs.summary: Represents an administrator approved, browser-enabled form template that is available on the server farm.

remarks.para: All administrator approved, browser-enabled form templates on the server are accessible by using the collection. The collection of form templates are also listed on the Manage form templates page of the Central Administration site. User-deployed form templates, typically deployed to a site collection, are not available by using the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Activate(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed

Docs.param: A object representing the site to which the form template is activated. Can be either the root site of the site collection or a subsite within the collection.
Docs.summary: Activates a form template to a SharePoint site collection.

remarks.para: An administrator approved form template is not available for use on a SharePoint site until it is activated to the site. Using the method for a form template will make the form template available in the Form Templates library of the root site in the site collection, and as a content type available for subsites of the site collection. The equivalent procedure on the Central Administration site is Activate to a Site Collection, available on the drop-down menu of a form template on the Manage form templates page.

example.para: The following example activates all form templates uploaded to the server farm to a site collection, and writes a message to the console for each form template that is activated.
An additional imports statement is required for the namespace.
example.code: Dim LocalFormsService As FormsService Dim LocalFarm As SPFarm Dim ft As FormTemplate Dim ExampleSite As SPSite Try LocalFarm = SPFarm.Local ExampleSite = New SPSite("http://server/sites/hrteam/") LocalFormsService = LocalFarm.Services.GetValue(Of FormsService)(FormsService.ServiceName) For Each ft In LocalFormsService.FormTemplates ft.Activate(ExampleSite) Console.WriteLine("Form template " & ft.Name & " activated to the " & ExampleSite.ToString()) Next Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() Catch ex As Exception Console.WriteLine("Error: " + ex.Message) Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() End Try

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Category { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the category of the form template.
Docs.value: A string representing the category to which the form template is assigned.

remarks.para: The property is optional. It can be used to sort the available form templates on the server farm using the Manage Form Templates page on the Central Administration site.
Note Accessing the property when it is null will result in an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CreatedTimeUtc As DateTime
public: property DateTime CreatedTimeUtc { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time, in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC), that the form template was created.
Docs.value: A DateTime value in UTC, also known as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataConnectionFileReferences As Collection(Of String)

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of Universal Data Connection (UDC) files that are referenced in the form template.
Docs.value: A collection of string values.

remarks.para: The string values returned in the collection are the file names of the UDC files.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Deactivate(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed

Docs.param: A object representing the site to which the form template is activated. Can be either the root site of the site collection or a subsite within the collection.
Docs.summary: Deactivates a form template from a SharePoint site collection.

remarks.para: Deactivating a form template from a site removes the form template from the Form Templates library of the root of the site collection and from the available content types of the site collection.

example.para: The following example deactivates all form templates uploaded to the server farm from the "HRDept" site collection, and writes a message to the console for each form template that is deactivated.
An additional imports statement is required for the namespace.
example.code: Dim LocalFormsService As FormsService Dim LocalFarm As SPFarm Dim ft As FormTemplate Dim ExampleSite As SPSite Try LocalFarm = SPFarm.Local ExampleSite = New SPSite("http://server/sites/HRDept/") LocalFormsService = LocalFarm.Services.GetValue(Of FormsService)(FormsService.ServiceName) For Each ft In LocalFormsService.FormTemplates ft.Deactivate(ExampleSite) Console.WriteLine("Form template " & ft.Name & " deactivated from the " & ExampleSite.ToString()) Next Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() Catch ex As Exception Console.WriteLine("Error: " + ex.Message) Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() End Try

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Description As String
public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the description of the form template.
Docs.value: A string representing the description of the form template.

remarks.para: The form template property corresponds to the optional description attribute of the wss element in the manifest.xsf file. The XPath of the wss element is xsf:extension/xsf:extension/xsf2:solutionDefinition/xsf2:solutionPropertiesExtension/xsf2:wss/.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property DisplayName As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ DisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the form template displayed on the Manage form templates page of the Central Administration site.
Docs.value: The name of the form template.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FeatureId As Guid
public: property Guid FeatureId { Guid get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the SharePoint feature identification (ID), if applicable, associated with the form template.
Docs.value: A Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) of the SharePoint feature used to register the form template on the server farm.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FormFolderPath As String
public: property System::String ^ FormFolderPath { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the path of the folder that contains the form template represented by the object.
Docs.value: The path of the folder that contains the form template.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FormId As String
public: property System::String ^ FormId { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the form template identification (ID) value.
Docs.value: A string representing the form template ID.

remarks.para: The ID value corresponds to the name attribute of the xDocumentClass element of the manifest.xsf file.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FormTemplateStatus As FormTemplate.FormTemplateState

Docs.summary: Gets the current state of the form template.
Docs.value: A value based on the enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FullTrust As Boolean
public: property bool FullTrust { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the form template security level is Full Trust.
Docs.value: true if the form template is Full Trust, false if its security level is domain.

remarks.para: Browser-enabled form templates that require a Full Trust security level need to be digitally signed. Use the property to determine if the form template is digitally signed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Uri GetAbsoluteUrl(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed
Public Function GetAbsoluteUrl (site As SPSite) As Uri

Docs.param: The object where the form template is located.
Docs.summary: Gets the full URL of a form template on a SharePoint site.
Docs.returns: A Uri, in the form of a URL, of the form template location.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Locale As String
public: property System::String ^ Locale { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the locale of the form template.
Docs.value: A string representing the form template locale.

remarks.para: The property returns a language code, such as en-us or ja-jp. The value corresponds to the formLocale attribute of the server element in the manifest.xsf file. The XPath of the server element is xsf:extensions/xsf:extension/xsf2:solutionDefinition/xsf2:server/.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ModifiedTimeUtc As DateTime
public: property DateTime ModifiedTimeUtc { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time, in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC), that the form template was last modified.
Docs.value: A DateTime value in UTC, also known as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Quiesce(valuetype System.TimeSpan maxDuration) cil managed

Docs.param: A object representing the maximum time a form can remain available to existing sessions until it is fully quiesced, in minutes.
Docs.summary: Quiesces, or takes offline, the form template.

remarks.para: Sessions that remain active beyond the are invalidated, and forms based on the quiesced form template will return an error on their next postback to the server.

Docs.summary: Provides the time when the changes from to .

Docs.value: A object.

remarks.para: The three possible values of the object are , , or .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Signed As Boolean
public: property bool Signed { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the form template is digitally signed.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: A browser-enabled form template must be digitally signed if deployed with a Full Trust security level. Use the property to determine if the security level is Full Trust.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SolutionId As Guid
public: property Guid SolutionId { Guid get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the solution identification (ID) of the form template.
Docs.value: A Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) associated with the form template.

remarks.para: The property is associated with the form template when it is either deployed to or registered on the server farm.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Unquiesce() cil managed

Docs.summary: Brings a form template back online so new forms can be created based on the form template that was previously quiesced.

remarks.para: The opposite of using the method to take a form offline, using this method allows you to bring a form back online after it has been quiesced. Sets the property to .

Docs.summary: Override provided for the method of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UserWorkflowEnabled As Boolean
public: property bool UserWorkflowEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the form template represented by the object is enabled as a declarative rules-based form that is part of a SharePoint workflow process.
Docs.value: true if the form is a declarative rules-based workflow form; otherwise false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WorkflowEnabled As Boolean
public: property bool WorkflowEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the form template can be used in a SharePoint workflow process.
Docs.value: A boolean value of true if the form can be used in a workflow, false if not.
